perturbation.original_text:
LIABILITY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT FROM ANY AND ALL CAUSES, INCLUDING,
BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROGRAM MALFUNCTION OR OPERATIONAL NEGLIGENCE, SHALL BE
LIMITED TO GENERAL MONEY DAMAGES IN AN AMOUNT NOT TO EXCEED THE TOTAL CHARGES
PAID BY ABW FOR THE SERVICES DURING THE MOST RECENT TWELVE (12) MONTHS OF THE
AGREEMENT. SUCH LIMITATION SHALL BE THE EXTENT OF PCQ OR ABW'S LIABILITY
REGARDLESS OF THE FORM IN WHICH ANY LEGAL OR EQUITABLE ACTION MAY BE BROUGHT
AGAINST PCQ OR ABW, AND THE FOREGOING SHALL CONSTITUTE PCQ'S OR ABW'S SOLE
REMEDY.  IN NO EVENT WILL EITHER PARTY BE RESPONSIBLE FOR LOST PROFITS OR
SPECIAL INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES WHICH ABW OR PCQ INCUR
OR EXPERIENCE ON ACCOUNT OF ENTERING INTO OR RELYING ON THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN
IF PCQ OR ABW HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
perturbation.changed_text:
LIABILITY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT FROM ANY AND ALL CAUSES, INCLUDING,
BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROGRAM MALFUNCTION OR OPERATIONAL NEGLIGENCE, SHALL BE
LIMITED TO GENERAL MONEY DAMAGES IN AN AMOUNT NOT TO EXCEED THE TOTAL CHARGES
PAID BY ABW FOR THE SERVICES DURING THE MOST RECENT TWELVE (12) MONTHS OF THE
AGREEMENT. IN THE CASE OF GROSS NEGLIGENCE OR WILLFUL MISCONDUCT, THIS LIMITATION WILL NOT APPLY.
SUCH LIMITATION SHALL BE THE EXTENT OF PCQ OR ABW'S LIABILITY
REGARDLESS OF THE FORM IN WHICH ANY LEGAL OR EQUITABLE ACTION MAY BE BROUGHT
AGAINST PCQ OR ABW, AND THE FOREGOING SHALL CONSTITUTE PCQ'S OR ABW'S SOLE
REMEDY.  IN NO EVENT WILL EITHER PARTY BE RESPONSIBLE FOR LOST PROFITS OR
SPECIAL INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES WHICH ABW OR PCQ INCUR
OR EXPERIENCE ON ACCOUNT OF ENTERING INTO OR RELYING ON THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN
IF PCQ OR ABW HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
perturbation.explanation: The added phrase 'In the case of gross negligence or willful misconduct, this limitation will not apply' creates a contradiction. It initially limits liability to charges paid in the last 12 months, but then introduces an exception for gross negligence, potentially opening the door to much higher liability. This contradiction makes the limitation of liability clause ambiguous and harder to enforce because it creates uncertainty about its scope.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding unambiguous contract terms and enforceability of liability limitations.
perturbation.location: Section 6. Limitations of Liability, Remedies On Default

perturbation.original_text:
This Agreement shall be interpreted, construed and enforced in all respects
in accordance with the laws of the State of Illinois, except with regards to its
rules regarding choice of law.  Each party irrevocably consents to the
jurisdiction of the courts of the State of Illinois and the federal courts
situated in the State of Illinois, in connection with any action to enforce the
provisions of this Agreement, to recover damages or other relief for breach or
default under this Agreement, or otherwise arising under or by reason of this
Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
This Agreement shall be interpreted, construed and enforced in all respects
in accordance with the laws of the State of Illinois, except with regards to its
rules regarding choice of law.  Each party irrevocably consents to the
jurisdiction of the courts of the State of Delaware in connection with any action to enforce the
provisions of this Agreement, to recover damages or other relief for breach or
default under this Agreement, or otherwise arising under or by reason of this
Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The change involves altering the jurisdiction from Illinois to Delaware, while maintaining Illinois law as the governing law. This presents a legal contradiction as the courts of Delaware would be interpreting the laws of Illinois, potentially leading to misinterpretations or complications in legal proceedings. Litigants might face uncertainty regarding the application of legal principles and the predictability of outcomes.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of jurisdiction and choice of law; potential conflict with established legal precedents and fairness principles.

perturbation.original_text:
Any payments which have not been received by PCQ within thirty (30)
days of the Invoice date shall be subject to a FINANCE CHARGE of 1.0% per month
which is a corresponding ANNUAL
PERCENTAGE RATE of 12% on the outstanding balance.
perturbation.changed_text:
Any payments which have not been received by PCQ within thirty (30)
days of the Invoice date shall be subject to a FINANCE CHARGE of 1.0% per month,
however the ANNUAL PERCENTAGE RATE will be decided by PCQ.
PERCENTAGE RATE of 12% on the outstanding balance.
perturbation.explanation: The change introduces a legal contradiction in the finance charge clause. While initially stating a finance charge of 1.0% per month (12% APR), the inserted phrase 'however the ANNUAL PERCENTAGE RATE will be decided by PCQ' creates uncertainty and contradicts the fixed APR. This allows PCQ to unilaterally alter the APR, potentially violating usury laws or creating an unfair and unenforceable contract term due to lack of clarity and mutual agreement on interest rates.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of usury laws, contract law principles requiring mutual agreement and clear terms, and consumer protection laws.
